intro: Anthocercis albicans, commonly known as the white anthocercis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring. Its botanical features include a slender, branched stem and a distinctive aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
